page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE BLOCK
page.content: This block is{mostly countryside}with 3 villages:{Hamsey}and{Offham}are small villages with old buildings whilst{Cooksbridge}grew up in the 19th and 20th centuries around the{railway {station}and{timber yard.}Most of the people in this block live in the two Lewes housing estates,{Malling}and {Landport.}The{many farms}concentrate on arable crops but some also graze livestock, especially near the river. Landport was built for the council by German prisoners of war in the 1940's. Malling is a mixture of council, police, prison authority and private housing. The{river Ouse}runs through the block and cuts a valley through the South Downs which surround it. There are many lovely walks and delightful picnic spots.
